p: Rubella virus (RUBV) is in the family Togaviridae [ 50]. RUBV is an important human pathogen associated with it birth defects, known congenital rubella syndrome (CRS), but through use of vaccines rubella and CRS are controlled [ 50]. We investigated if RUBV would grow in Vero cell and HEp-2 cells, but found it could only be propagated in Vero cells ( Fig 5A). This is likely related to features of the antiviral IFN pathway [ 51] but was not specifically investigated. KD of GCGR, PYCR1, SVOPL, or ZNF205 led to 10->100-fold increases in RUBV, where KD of ZNF205 led to highest increases in RUBV.
